presentation_title: He became poor so we can become rich

sections.section: Why We Should Be Rich
1. Jesus Became Poor So We Might Become Rich

verses.text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sakes He became poor, that you through His poverty might become rich.
highlights: you through His poverty might become rich

sections.section: 2. Blessed to Be a Blessing (Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, Job)

verses.text: I will make you a great nation; I will bless you And make your name great; And you shall be a blessing. I will bless those who bless you, And I will curse him who curses you; And in you all the families of the earth shall be blessed.
highlights: all the families of the earth shall be blessed

verses.text: Abram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold.
Now the land was not able to support them, that they might dwell together, for their possessions were so great that they could not dwell together.

Then Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year a hundredfold; and the Lord blessed him. The man began to prosper, and continued prospering until he became very prosperous; for he had possessions of flocks and possessions of herds and a great number of servants. So the Philistines envied him.
Thus the man became exceedingly prosperous, and had large flocks, female and male servants, and camels and donkeys.
Now the Lord blessed the latter days of Job more than his beginning; for he had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, one thousand yoke of oxen, and one thousand female donkeys.
highlights: the Lord blessed the latter days of Job more than his beginning

sections.section: 3. Money Answers Everything

verses.text: A feast is made for laughter, And wine makes merry; But money answers everything.

sections.section: 4. Prosperity as a Sign That Brings Belief

verses.text: But they said, "We have certainly seen that the Lord is with you. So we said, 'Let there now be an oath between us, between you and us; and let us make a covenant with you,
And his master saw that the Lord was with him and that the Lord made all he did to prosper in his hand.

And they told him, saying, "Joseph is still alive, and he is governor over all the land of Egypt." And Jacob's heart stood still, because he did not believe them. But when they told him all the words which Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the carts which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived. Then Israel said, "It is enough. Joseph my son is still alive. I will go and see him before I die."
highlights: he is governor over all the land of Egypt
the spirit of Jacob their father revived

verses.text: God be merciful to us and bless us, And cause His face to shine upon us, Selah That Your way may be known on earth, Your salvation among all nations.
highlights: Your way may be known on earth

sections.section: How to Become Rich?
1. Tithe

verses.text:
מַעֲשֵׂר (maʿăśēr) – tithe, tenth part

עָשַׁר (ʿāšar) – to be or become rich, to make rich

Bring all the tithes into the storehouse, That there may be food in My house, And try Me now in this," Says the Lord of hosts, "If I will not open for you the windows of heaven And pour out for you such blessing That there will not be room enough to receive it.
highlights: Bring all the tithes into the storehouse
open for you the windows of heaven
pour out for you such blessing

verses.text: Honor the Lord with your possessions, And with the firstfruits of all your increase; So your barns will be filled with plenty, And your vats will overflow with new wine.
highlights: Honor the Lord with your possessions
your barns will be filled with plenty

verses.text: And you shall remember the Lord your God, for it is He who gives you power to get wealth, that He may establish His covenant which He swore to your fathers, as it is this day.
highlights: He who gives you power to get wealth

sections.section: 2. Sow Sparingly, Reap Sparingly — Sow Bountifully

verses.text: But this I say: He who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
highlights: sows sparingly will also reap sparingly
sows bountifully will also reap bountifully

verses.text: And God is able to make all grace abound toward you, that you, always having all sufficiency in all things, may have an abundance for every good work.
Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over will be put into your bosom. For with the same measure that you use, it will be measured back to you.
highlights: Give, and it will be given to you
good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over

sections.section: Benefits of Tithing / Offering
1. To Prove That Jesus Is Alive (Melchizedek)

verses.text: Here mortal men receive tithes, but there he receives them, of whom it is witnessed that he lives.

Then Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was the priest of God Most High. And he blessed him and said: "Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Possessor of heaven and earth; And blessed be God Most High, Who has delivered your enemies into your hand." And he gave him a tithe of all.
highlights: he gave him a tithe of all

sections.section: 2. To Show That God Is the One Who Made You Rich

verses.text: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, "I have raised my hand to the Lord, God Most High, the Possessor of heaven and earth, that I will take nothing, from a thread to a sandal strap, and that I will not take anything that is yours, lest you should say, 'I have made Abram rich'—
highlights: the Possessor of heaven and earth

sections.section: 3. By Faith Abel Offered

verses.text: By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts; and through it he being dead still speaks.

sections.section: 4. To Find Where Your Heart Is

verses.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
highlights: where your treasure is, there your heart will be also

verses.text: Now Jesus sat opposite the treasury and saw how the people put money into the treasury. And many who were rich put in much. Then one poor widow came and threw in two mites, which make a quadrans.
highlights: saw how the people put money

verses.text: So He called His disciples to Himself and said to them, "Assuredly, I say to you that this poor widow has put in more than all those who have given to the treasury; for they all put in out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty put in all that she had, her whole livelihood."
highlights: this poor widow has put in more
she out of her poverty put in all that she had

sections.section: 5. Honor God With Your Money

verses.text: Honor the Lord with your possessions, And with the firstfruits of all your increase; So your barns will be filled with plenty, And your vats will overflow with new wine.
highlights: Honor the Lord with your possessions

sections.section: 6. To Come Out of Debt (Elisha and the Widow)

verses.text: Now it came to pass, when the vessels were full, that she said to her son, "Bring me another vessel." And he said to her, "There is not another vessel." So the oil ceased. Then she came and told the man of God. And he said, "Go, sell the oil and pay your debt; and you and your sons live on the rest."
highlights: Go, sell the oil and pay your debt

sections.section: General Questions
1. Tithing Is For Who? (Milk vs Strong Meat)

verses.text: And I, brethren, could not speak to you as to spiritual people but as to carnal, as to babes in Christ. I fed you with milk and not with solid food; for until now you were not able to receive it, and even now you are still not able;
highlights: milk and not with solid food

verses.text: For everyone who partakes only of milk is unskilled in the word of righteousness, for he is a babe. But solid food belongs to those who are of full age, that is, those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.
highlights: solid food belongs to those who are of full age

sections.section: 2. Money Is the Root of All Evil?

verses.text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil, for which some have strayed from the faith in their greediness, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

sections.section: 3. Shouldn't I Be Content With What I Have?

verses.text: Now godliness with contentment is great gain. For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out. And having food and clothing, with these we shall be content.
highlights: godliness with contentment is great gain

verses.text: But those who desire to be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and harmful lusts which drown men in destruction and perdition. For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil, for which some have strayed from the faith in their greediness, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
highlights: the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil

verses.text: Command those who are rich in this present age not to be haughty, nor to trust in uncertain riches but in the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy. Let them do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to give, willing to share, storing up for themselves a good foundation for the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
highlights: the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy

sections.section: 4. Where Should I Give Tithe?

verses.text: Bring all the tithes into the storehouse, That there may be food in My house, And try Me now in this," Says the Lord of hosts, "If I will not open for you the windows of heaven And pour out for you such blessing That there will not be room enough to receive it.
highlights: open for you the windows of heaven

verses.text: Let him who is taught the word share in all good things with him who teaches. Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.
highlights: whatever a man sows, that he will also reap

verses.text: Here mortal men receive tithes, but there he receives them, of whom it is witnessed that he lives.
But he who received seed on the good ground is he who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and produces: some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
